title: Tomato Butter Bean Stew
text: A tasty, hearty bean stew! Serves 4.

title: Tomato Butter Bean Stew
text:
Ingredients

Olive oil
1 small red onion, finely diced
Salt
4 cloves of garlic, finely sliced
Pinch of chilli flakes
1 tbsp oregano
Generous grind of black pepper
1 tbsp tomato puree
200g cherry tomatoes, halved
1 can chopped tomatoes
Pinch of sugar
Half a stock cube
2 can butter beans, incl. liquid
Squeeze of lemon
Baguette

title: Tomato Butter Bean Stew
text:
Method

Sweat down the diced red onion in some olive oil and a grind of salt, until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Saute garlic for 1 minute, before frying off chilli, oregano, black pepper and tomato paste.
Add both cherry and chopped tomatoes, with a pinch of sugar and half a stock cube. Bring to a simmer for 10 minutes.
Pour in butter beans along with the liquid from the cans and a squeeze of lemon juice. Simmer gently for another 10 minutes, adding water as necessary to achieve desired consistency.
Adjust seasoning to taste and serve with fresh crusty baguette.


Possible additions

A few handfuls of spinach.
Sliced pieces of a good quality sausage.

title: Dal Makhani
text: Dishoom’s famous dal but quickly (ish!). Punjabi comfort food! Serves 3 as a main, 4 as a side.

title: Dal Makhani
text:
Ingredients

2 cans black lentils (400g) [urad dal]
2 generous knobs of butter
1/2 a white onion
5 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1 inch of ginger, finely chopped
1 red chilli, finely chopped
2 tbsp of tomato puree
3 tsp garam masala
2 tsp coriander
1 tsp cumin
1/2 tsp chilli powder
Splash of double/whipping cream
Salt and pepper

title: Dal Makhani
text:
Method

Boil the lentils for 1 hour in the liquid from the tin and a little water.
Heat a large knob of butter in a saucepan, saute onion until translucent, then add most of the chilli (save a little for topping), garlic and ginger for a couple of minutes.
Add dry spices and fry until fragrant before adding the tomato paste and drained lentils.
Cover the lentils with water and bring to the boil. Then simmer on a low heat with the lid on for 2 hours. Check regularly that there is enough water and stir to prevent the dal sticking to the bottom of the pan.
Use a stick blender to break up some of the lentils, but leave some lentils intact. Finish with a splash of cream and another knob of butter.
Serve with rice of naan bread, coriander and the remaining diced chilli.

Inspiration: Dishoom

title: Banana Pancakes
text: Bananas! Makes about 18, 4” diameter, pancakes.

title: Banana Pancakes
text:
Ingredients

1 egg
2 ripe bananas
1 tsp baking powder
120g self-raising flour
225ml milk
Knob of butter

title: Banana Pancakes
text:
Method

Mash the bananas in a bowl.
Whisk in the egg with a fork.
Mix in half the flour, then half the milk, followed by the rest of the flour and the rest of the milk.
To complete the batter, mix in the baking powder.
Heat a frying pan with a knob of butter, spoon in three or four dollops of mixture, fry for two minutes on each side.
Repeat. Top with your choice of fresh fruit and/or maple syrup.

title: Banana Pancakes
text:
Possible additions

Press a few blueberry’s into each pancake whilst frying for some delicious, gooey flavour bombs!

title: Afghan Chickpea Curry
text: Chickpeas and lentils come together to make a delicious meaty curry. Serves 4 as a main, 6 as a side.

title: Afghan Chickpea Curry
text:
Ingredients

3 tbsp butter
1 cinnamon stick
4-6 curry leaves
2 shallots (or 1 onion), finely chopped
3 garlic cloves, minced
Thumb of ginger, minced
120g red lentils
1 litre chicken (or vegetable) stock
Salt and pepper
2 jars of chickpeas, drained
1/4 tsp baking powder
1 tbsp coriander powder
1 tbsp cumin powder
2 tsp turmeric powder
2 tsp garam masala

title: Afghan Chickpea Curry
text:
Method

Melt the butter in over medium high heat. Add the cinnamon and curry leaves, toast for 30 seconds. Fry the onion until translucent, adding ginger and garlic half way.
Fry off the spices (coriander, cumin, turmeric and garam masala) for 30 seconds. Add the lentils and stir to coat in the spices.
Pour in the stock with a turn of salt. Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes with the lid on.
Add the chickpeas and baking soda. Bring back to a simmer again for 30 minutes with the lid. Simmer for a further 5-10 minutes without the lid to thicken to the desired consistency.
Serve with rice and/or flatbreads. Top with fresh coriander.

Inspiration: Recipe Tin Eats

title: Tomato and Aubergine One-Pot Baked Pasta
text: Delicious buttery, hearty pasta! Serves 4.

title: Tomato and Aubergine One-Pot Baked Pasta
text:
Ingredients

60ml olive oil
2 aubergines, quartered lengthways and then each quarter cut in half widthways
350g cherry tomatoes, half sliced and half left whole
400g tin of chopped tomatoes
1 tsp dried oregano
20g basil leaves, roughly torn, plus a few extra leaves to serve
6 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
1 red chilli, sliced in half lengthways
2 tbsp tomato paste
1 tsp caster sugar
100g unsalted butter, cut into 2cm cubes
250g dried fusilloni
400ml boiling water
Parmesan, finely grated
Salt and black pepper

title: Tomato and Aubergine One-Pot Baked Pasta
text:
Method

Preheat the oven to 200°C fan.
Put the oil into a large ovenproof sauté pan, along with the aubergines, 1 teaspoon of salt and a good grind of pepper. Toss to combine, then arrange the aubergines skin side down. Roast for 30 minutes, until nicely golden and starting to catch in places.
Add all the remaining ingredients to the pan, apart from the Parmesan, along with a healthy amount of salt and pepper. Stir to combine, then bake for another 30 minutes, covered.
Give everything a good stir and cook for a final 10-15 minutes, uncovered, until the sauce clings to the pasta. Serve with Parmesan and extra basil leaves sprinkled over.

Inspiration: Yotam Ottolenghi ‘Comfort’

title: Chicken Tikka
text: Eat as a side or whip up a masala sauce to make it a main dish. Makes around 36 bite-sized pieces of chicken tikka.

title: Chicken Tikka
text:
Ingredients

600g chicken breast, cut into bite sized pieces
125g Greek yogurt
Healthy squeeze of lemon juice
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
1/2 inch of ginger, finely chopped
1 tbsp garam masala
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp coriander
1 tsp paprika
1 tsp turmeric
1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds
Pinch of chilli flakes
Healthy grind of salt
Healthy grind of pepper

title: Chicken Tikka
text:
Method

Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl and leave in the fridge for as long as possible. Min 2 hours, max 48 hours.
When ready to cook, preheat the oven to 200°C fan.
Skewer the chicken on (soaked) wooden sticks, and place in the oven for 20 minutes, turning half way through.

Inspiration: Tyler Butt

title: Italian Sausage Ragu
text: A delicious ragu! Serves 4.

title: Italian Sausage Ragu
text:
Ingredients

1/2 onion, finely diced
3 garlic cloves
6 Italian sausages (w/fennel)
A healthy splash of red wine
1 bay leaf
Pinch of chilli flakes
Salt
Pepper
120ml milk
2 cans chopped tomatoes
Pinch of sugar
Rigatoni

title: Italian Sausage Ragu
text:
Method

Fry the onion in some olive oil for a few minutes, and then add the garlic.
Squeeze the sausage meat out of their casings into the pan and fry until brown, mixing to break them up.
Deglaze the pan with red wine. Throw in a bay leaf and chilli flakes, before pouring in the milk and stir for 3 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes and a pinch of sugar and simmer for 25 minutes.
Meanwhile cook the rigatoni according to the packet.
Season the sauce and stir through the pasta. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan.
